results.title: Children's circle
results.brief_description: A quality series that brings outstanding children’s books to the screen. The stories bring alive the actual illustrations from the book, through animation and iconographic techniques. Honoured by awards at Film Festivals worldwide, these programs are the perfect bridge between video and reading.

results.title: Children's aggression: its origin and control (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Examines the basis for normal aggression in young children, and presents methods for effectively managing this behaviour. Laboratory demonstrations and filmed examples of children’s aggression illustrate its types and causes

results.title: Childhood: the enchanted years
results.brief_description: An introduction to the study of the physical and mental development of the child from birth to four years of age is presented in this film. Shows how children learn to reach, perceive, walk and talk. Of particular interest are the simple perceptual experiments which show the reactions of the psychological mechanisms of the child.

results.title: Childhood matters
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Southern California Consortium and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 26 of Series “Time to grow”.
In this final episode of the “Time to grow” series, issues are raised on child development and importantly on the question, “Does childhood matter?”. It summarises the other programs in the series and endeavours to give a complete overview of child development from infancy to adolescence.

results.title: Childhood aggression: a social learning approach to family therapy (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Phillip R. Blake, PRB Productions, Oregan Research Institute and Steven D McAdam
results.brief_description: This film documents Tim’s aggressive behaviour, how it makes the family miserable and hinders Tim at school. Once the need for help has been established, the family contact the Oregan Research Institute Family Centre and move through the treatment process. The widespread changes occurring within the family as treatment progresses is shown.
results.title_for_label: Childhood aggression: a social learning approach to family therapy (TEFC)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Phillip R. Blake, PRB Productions, Oregan Research Institute and Steven D McAdam

results.title: Child survival alliance
results.brief_description: Looks at Colombia’s massive attempt to immunize all its children. Three days a year are set aside by the government to give the children vaccines against polio, diptheria, whooping cough, tetanus and measles.

results.title: Child soldiers [Widescreen] (D)
results.creator_credit: Andrew Ogilvie, Alan Lindsay, OPB, ABC-TV (Australia), ScreenWest and Electric Pictures (Aust)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Big picture”.
This is an extremely disturbing documentary on the use and abuse of children as young as 10 years old being recruited as child soldiers by various means - voluntary or involuntary - through abduction, intimidation, coercion, or exploitation of a child’s social circumstances. More than thirty nations globally participate in this barbaric and inhumane practice involving over 300,000 children (conservative estimate by the United Nations) who are brutalised, drugged, brainwashed, and indoctrinated to kill and commit atrocities in civil wars and armed conflict. From Southern Sudan to Uganda, Burma, Columbia and Sierra Leone we are confronted with some of these young soldiers (girls as well as boys) and their horrific accounts of life as a child soldier. Many tell of their dangerous attempts at escape, returning home, only to be kidnapped again and again. However even more distressing is the enormous challenge these ex child soldiers have to face in overcoming the abuse and trauma which they have suffered, both physically and psychologically. Many of them end up homeless, too frightened to return home. And it is not only third world countries who recruit underage soldiers. The US recruit 17 year olds and Great Britain has no hesitation in sending 16 year olds off to war. Both the United Nations and the International Criminal Court are trying to resolve this human crisis but it is going to be a long hard struggle and in the meantime tragically, hundreds of thousands of young children worldwide are pawns in an adult game of violence and conflict. Narrated by Anthony LaPaglia. NOTE: CONTAINS MANY VISUALLY DISTURBING IMAGES.
